title: A Year On, Ferguson Killing Is Recalled
title_page: A Year On, Ferguson Killing Is Recalled - The New York Times
text:
FERGUSON, Mo. — As demonstrators shouted, “Hands up, don’t shoot,” and marched toward West Florissant Avenue, the scene here on Saturday morning looked in many ways like a flashback to the protests that followed the police killing of Michael Brown a year ago.
Michael Brown Sr., whose son and namesake was fatally shot by a Ferguson police officer last Aug. 9, was near the head of the procession. He added a stuffed animal to the road memorial near where his son died. Protesters used a megaphone to lead familiar chants. Police officers blocked traffic as drivers honked horns in support of the marchers.
Twelve months since Mr. Brown’s death in this St. Louis suburb touched off a national protest movement, demonstrators have returned to its streets for a series of commemorations this weekend that are expected to last through Monday.
“To a lot of people, Mike Brown was a big shock,” said Carlatta Bussey, a St. Louis resident who attended Saturday’s march with her 7-year-old son. “But to the black community, it wasn’t a big shock because it happens all the time.”
